subject: Re: Hi, We've received your migration request. We aim to complete your ...
preview: Hi WP,   Just wanted to check in to see how the migration for australiathegift.com.au went, and if you had plans for updating the dns? If you need any assistance, please let us know.   Reply in our Me

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia assigned to Heath Maguire

full_threads.body:
Hi WP,

Just wanted to check in to see how the migration for australiathegift.com.au went, and if you had plans for updating the dns? If you need any assistance, please let us know.
Reply in our Messenger

You may need to sign in to Kinsta again.

You can also reply directly to this email.
Roger from Kinsta
On Thu, Dec 10, 2020 at 07:42 PM, "Alessandro" <alessandro.cardillo@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Looks like you are currently away from your desk. I'll go ahead and close this conversation for now. Please feel free to reopen this chat or to create a new ticket in case you have any question, we are just a click away! Have a great day

On Thu, Dec 10, 2020 at 06:46 PM, "Alessandro" <alessandro.cardillo@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Is there anything else I can do for you today? :)

On Thu, Dec 10, 2020 at 06:13 PM, "Alessandro" <alessandro.cardillo@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Hey thanks for reaching out! As Jed is offline I'll take care of your request :). If you won't to avoid a new migration you can use a plugin to export and then import the orders. I never personally tried but the following plugin looks to have great reviews:

https://wordpress.org/plugins/order-import-export-for-woocommerce/

On Thu, Dec 10, 2020 at 06:10 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Thanks Jed. Looking good. Question, what is the best way to bring over the orders received during the migration process? This client gets around 3-4 orders an hour

On Thu, Dec 10, 2020 at 05:53 PM, "Jed Banaag" <jed.banaag@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

I'm happy to report that the migration for www.australiathegift.com[.]au has completed!

You can do a quick preview of the site using this temporary URL: https://www-g4zy0.skipdns.link/ (Please take note that some functionalities might not work properly during SkipDNS preview and load time may be slower.)

Please take note that I had to comment out this code block in wp-config.php since it's resulting to an internal server error during testing:

'default' => array(

'127.0.0.1:11211',

)

);

We have a complete guide here on how you can test your site(s) from our server before switching over your DNS. For these methods you'll want to use the IP: 35.201.9.248

Option 1 from that guide is the easiest, but should only be used to test the overall functionality of your site(s). If you need to test for performance or page speed statistics, you would want to go with Options 2 or 3 depending on your local operating system.

If you elect to test your site(s) using Options 2 or 3, don't forget to revert the changes to your hosts file after your testing!

The site(s) have been switched to PHP 7.3 and if you'd like to upgrade the PHP version we have a guide here. I've uploaded our Kinsta Cache plugin, and you can clear our server side caching at anytime by following our guide here.

Please test everything and let us know if you need any help.

If you are satisfied with your testing, you can point your domain(s) to the ip: 35.201.9.248 . Alternatively you can point your domain's nameservers to our Kinsta DNS. We have a guide here on how to point your DNS to us with both ways.

We have a small list of plugins that are disallowed on our infrastructure, please take a look at it.

https://kinsta.com/knowledgebase/disallowed-plugins/

If applicable, we have moved some unnecessary files and disallowed plugins to the 'old' folder located within the ~/private directory on your instance.

Also, please note that I've setup a self signed SSL for testing purposes only. It will show as a custom SSL in the My Kinsta portal. In order for your site to load properly over https, you will need to install our free Let's Encrypt SSL after you have pointed your DNS to us.

We have a guide below on how you can install our free SSL:

https://kinsta.com/knowledgebase/how-to-install-ssl-certificate/

We do a general test of your site(s) after the migration has completed, and if things look well we make a post-migration backup in case you need to restore from it for any reason (such as you make some change/modification after the migration that breaks the site). You can find that backup located in your MyKinsta panel >> Sites Tab >> Manage the site you are working on >> Backups tab >> Manual Tab. Please note this backup will only be available for 14 days in case you need it.

Please check the site(s) and change the DNS as soon as you can. If you update anything on the old server (before making the DNS change), the changes will be lost!

If you have any further questions regarding this migration feel free to let me know, otherwise good luck with your site(s)!

When you have a moment, we'd love to hear your feedback on this migration here.

On Thu, Dec 10, 2020 at 05:20 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:
On Thu, Dec 10, 2020 at 05:19 PM, "Jed Banaag" <jed.banaag@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Hi, I will now work on the migration of www.australiathegift.com[.]au. I will have it migrated over to the australiathegiftcomau install. I'll let you know once it's completed.

On Thu, Dec 10, 2020 at 05:14 PM, "Hristina Mitkova" <hristina.mitkova@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Hi there,

I checked with Jed, he actually had created already different install australiathegiftcomau and will migrate the site there. No need for you to create any new migration request. :)

I am transferring the thread now to Jed and our migration team so they will follow up with you once completed with further steps to follow.

On Thu, Dec 10, 2020 at 05:11 PM, "Hristina Mitkova" <hristina.mitkova@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

All right, that was the question of you need the exact same request or a new one. Give me a moment and I will let you know if you need to create a new migration request. Bear with me.

On Thu, Dec 10, 2020 at 05:08 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

No, can you please do it in a separate install? You can call in australiathegift2 please

On Thu, Dec 10, 2020 at 05:07 PM, "Hristina Mitkova" <hristina.mitkova@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

So you need your current australiathegift site to be overwritten, is this correct?

On Thu, Dec 10, 2020 at 05:06 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

The exact same one please.

On Thu, Dec 10, 2020 at 05:05 PM, "Hristina Mitkova" <hristina.mitkova@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Hi there,

Could you please clarify if you would need the exact same migration request processed or you need a different one as you mentioned you need under separate install?

On Thu, Dec 10, 2020 at 05:03 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Hey Jed, sorry mate, can you please migrate it on a separate install.

Do you still have the details? It's giving us some grief, so I think it may be best to start it again

On Thu, Dec 10, 2020 at 04:58 PM, "Jed Banaag" <jed.banaag@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Cool! Take care and have a good one!

On Thu, Dec 10, 2020 at 04:57 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

All good, leave it with me. thanks Jed.

On Thu, Dec 10, 2020 at 04:57 PM, "Jed Banaag" <jed.banaag@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

You're welcome! Do you need me to transfer this chat to our Support Team or would you like to run some tests on your site first?

On Thu, Dec 10, 2020 at 04:56 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Great, thanks Jed!

Yep I'm updating now... Their backend is crazy slow though!!

On Thu, Dec 10, 2020 at 04:55 PM, "Jed Banaag" <jed.banaag@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Actually, I just ran a scan and it looks clean.

Just make sure to keep your plugins/themes updated.

On Thu, Dec 10, 2020 at 04:53 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Correct, thanks Jed.

On Thu, Dec 10, 2020 at 04:53 PM, "Jed Banaag" <jed.banaag@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Sure! I will have the migration request cancelled.

For checking of potential malware, I can have this conversation transferred to our Malware and Abuse. I'm assuming that the migrated site is australiathegift, correct?

On Thu, Dec 10, 2020 at 04:50 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Yes, thank you, we were having problems with it as it's a large site, but managed to figure it out.

Can I ask for a sweep of any malicious code though? Is that possible?

On Thu, Dec 10, 2020 at 04:49 PM, "Jed Banaag" <jed.banaag@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Oh okay, I was just actually creating the site "australiathegiftcomau" in your account.

Should we go ahead and cancel this migration request?

On Thu, Dec 10, 2020 at 04:45 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Hi Jed, we have actually migrated it all ready

On Thu, Dec 10, 2020 at 04:43 PM, "Jed Banaag" <jed.banaag@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Hi,

I am now available to work on the migration of www.australiathegift.com[.]au. I will keep you posted as we progress.

Regards,
Jed B.

On Thu, Dec 10, 2020 at 03:32 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Hey guys, do you have an update on this?

On Thu, Dec 10, 2020 at 12:38 PM, "Notifications" <messages@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Hi,

We've received your migration request. We aim to complete your migration in one business day.

What happens next:

  1. If you've selected to schedule the migration, we will get in touch within one business day to arrange a time for the migration. For migrations that you've selected to be done as soon as possible, we'll send an update when the migration is about to begin.
  2. We will take care of the migration at the scheduled time. We'll let you know when we get started.
  3. We'll let you know once the migration is complete with instructions about how you can test your website on Kinsta, and for updating your DNS if everything looks good.

Please note that we don't process site migrations on weekends.

You have 7 days to arrange a time with us. Afterward, the migration will be canceled and credited to your account.

The Kinsta team
